article:
These monasteries were dissolved by King Henry VIII of England in the
Dissolution of the Monasteries. The list is by no means exhaustive, since over
800 religious houses existed before the Reformation, and virtually every town,
of any size, had at least one abbey, priory, convent or friary in it. (Often
many small houses of monks, nuns, canons or friars.)
